p: The ATSB product class is currently at Stage 2 of the VCAG evaluation pathway ( Fig 1). The success of an ATSB strategy relies on attracting mosquitoes to and having them feed on toxic sugar meals sprayed on plants or used in bait stations. The use of sugar feeding to reduce mosquito populations was first reported by Lea in 1965 [ 41] and then other studies [ 42â€“ 49] in A. albopictus, other culicines, and sand flies.
